intro: Iris pallida var. junonia, commonly known as the Junonia iris, is a striking ornamental plant native to the eastern United States. It features slender, upright stems that bear showy, lavender-blue flowers with a distinctive white throat. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in partial to full shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that provide an elegant backdrop to its blooms. This variety is prized for its beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
